node.title: Michelle Obama says Ketanji Brown Jackson gives Black girls "new dream to dream"
node.description: "So many women of color now have a new role model to look up to as she serves on the highest court of the land," Obama said.

node.title: Will Smith banned from Oscars for 10 years, Academy says
node.description: The announcement came several weeks after Will Smith slapped Chris Rock during the awards show.

node.title: Grenade found among the spuds on chip factory conveyor belt
node.description: Amongst hundreds of thousands of muddy spuds a World War II era grenade was picked up on a conveyor belt at an Auckland potato factory earlier this week.

node.title: Wisconsin governor vetoes Republican election bills
node.description: The Republican legislature does not have the votes to override his vetoes. The bills are part of a nationwide GOP effort to reshape the elections.

node.title: Verdicts in for men accused of plot to kidnap Michigan governor
node.description: Adam Fox, Barry Croft Jr., Daniel Harris and Brandon Caserta were charged with conspiracy, and three faced weapons charges.

node.title: Teacher's killer gets 36 years in prison: "How could you do such a thing"
node.description: Her killing - as she walked just a few minutes from her home - fueled concerns that women aren't safe on the streets of Britain's capital.

node.title: Motorists are seeing some relief amid dip in gas prices
node.description: One gas expert predicts that the average per-gallon price could sink below $4 in the coming days.

node.title: Ferrari fastest in F1 practice
node.description: Ferrari's promising start to the Formula One season continued on Friday as the glamour team dominated free practice at the Australian Grand Prix at a revamped Albert Park circuit.

node.title: Idris Elba on new Sonic film, music and those James Bond rumors
node.description: In his new film "Sonic the Hedgehog 2," Idris Elba plays the villainous Knuckles, an echidna warrior.

node.title: Mocked by Biden as "rubble," the Russian ruble has bounced back
node.description: The ruble has bounced back after its initial plunge following Western sanctions. Here's why.

node.title: Boy's brain damaged by MLB player's errant throw, mother claims
node.description: Angel Stadium and other major league parks have expanded protective netting in recent years to increase safety.

node.title: What's my tax rate? Here are the income brackets for 2022.
node.description: Depending on how much you earned last year, you may pay taxes at different rates. Here's how to find out where you fall.

node.title: Parents struggle to find baby formula amid national shortage
node.description: In some states, more than half of baby formula products were out of stock, new data shows.

node.title: Jackson's Supreme Court confirmation resonates across generations
node.description: Ketanji Brown Jackson's confirmation to the Supreme Court makes her the first Black female justice

node.title: Watch Live: White House celebrates Jackson's Supreme Court confirmation
node.description: Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson was confirmed to the Supreme Court in a 53-47 vote Thursday.

node.title: Proud Boys conspirator reaches plea deal in Jan. 6 case
node.description: Charles Donohoe, who has close ties to Proud Boys leader Enrique Tarrio, is charged with conspiracy and other high-level counts stemming from his participation in the assault on the Capitol.

node.title: Suspect in shooting of Lady Gaga's dogwalker mistakenly released from jail
node.description: He was released due to a "clerical error."

node.title: America's labor shortage is actually an immigrant shortage
node.description: The U.S. is missing 2 million workers because of slowing immigration, one estimate shows. That's leading to unfilled jobs.

node.title: Man found guilty in 1984 killing of Colorado woman after DNA match
node.description: Jurors found Alex Ewing guilty in the killing of Patricia Smith in 1984 after more than four hours of deliberations.

node.title: China paid for U.S. social media influencers to tout Beijing Olympics
node.description: Government filings show China paid a company in New Jersey to recruit a "Real Housewives" star, a TikTok "brand king" and others to promote its Winter Games.

node.title: Richest people in the world
node.description: Forbes' annual billionaires list reveals which big-money titan has the most money of them all.

node.title: Dramatic video shows jet skid off runaway and split in half
node.description: The accident temporarily caused operations to shut down at the country's biggest airport, impacting hundreds of flights.

node.title: Nissan, NASA teaming on "game changing" electric vehicle batteries
node.description: Nissan says they'll be so stable they could be used in pacemakers. The Japanese giant says the all-solid-state battery will replace the lithium-ion battery now in use and promises to charge much more quickly and be lighter yet safe.

node.title: Ferrero recalls Kinder chocolates in U.S. over Salmonella fears
node.description: The move follows recalls earlier in the week in the U.K. and several European countries over concerns around products from a Belgian  factory, though the bacteria haven't been found in any Kinder products yet.

node.title: Mother accused of drowning her baby and toddler in bathtub
node.description: The children's father returned home when his wife "allegedly told him that she had hurt the children," authorities said.

node.title: Men accused of impersonating federal agents investigated for possible Iranian intelligence ties
node.description: The two are scheduled for a detention hearing today.

node.title: Widow used GoFundMe proceeds to buy gifts for husband's alleged killer
node.description: After Jamie Faith was gunned down, his wife Jennifer bought her husband's alleged shooter airline tickets and a large screen TV, and gave him use of her credit cards.

node.title: How to watch SpaceX launch first private crew to space station
node.description: The Axiom-1 flight carries a crew of four private citizens, with a former NASA astronaut as mission commander.

node.title: Jamie Faith murder: Unraveling the plot
node.description: In 2020, the American Airlines manager was gunned down during a morning walk with his wife and dog. Two years later, his wife, Jennifer, pleaded guilty for her role in orchestrating his death.

node.title: Man convicted of setting wildfire that killed dozen California condors
node.description: Ivan Gomez, 31, was convicted by a judge of starting the August 2020 150,000 Big Sur Dolan fire that also endangered the lives of 14 firefighters who had use emergency shelters. Three were hospitalized.
